snippet: Gu Kailai, a lawyer, spent more than two decades turning the government posts of her husband, Bo Xilai, into lucrative business opportunities.
abstract: Scandal involving the death of British businessman Neil Heywood in China appears to be evolving into a broader investigation into the wealth and financial interests of politically powerful Chinese couple Bo Xilai and his wife Gu Kailai; analysts say Communist Party leaders, by moving decisively against Gu and Bo, are trying to send a message to allies of Bo, who are still putting up resistance.

byline.original: By ANDREW JACOBS and MICHAEL WINES
byline.contributor: Andrew Jacobs reported from Beijing and New York, and Michael Wines from Beijing. Keith Bradsher contributed reporting from Hong Kong, and John F. Burns and Ravi Somaiya from London.

lead_paragraph: Gu Kailai, a lawyer, spent more than two decades turning the government posts of her husband, Bo Xilai, into lucrative business opportunities.

headline.seo: China’s Inquiry of Bo Xilai and Gu Kailai Widens to Their Wealth
headline.main: Murder Aside, China Inquiry Puts Couple’s Wealth on Trial
headline.print_headline: Murder Aside, China Inquiry Puts Couple’s Wealth on Trial
